metadata.title: CVE-2021-4104 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: JMSAppender in Log4j 1.2 is vulnerable to deserialization of untrusted datawhen the attacker has write access to the Log4j configuration. The attackercan provide TopicBindingName and TopicConnectionFactoryBindingNameconfigurations causing JMSAppender to perform JNDI requests that result inremote code execution in a similar fashion to CVE-2021-44228. Note thisissue only affects Log4j 1.2 when specifically configured to useJMSAppender, which is not the default. Apache Log4j 1.2 reached end of lifein August 2015. Users should upgrade to Log4j 2 as it addresses numerousother issues from the previous versions.

criterions.comment: apache-log4j1.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
